info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:21PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Litchfield and southeastern Berkshire Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 221 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Winsted, or 7 miles north of Torrington, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... New Hartford, Sheffield, Norfolk, Otis, Sandisfield, Winsted, New Hartford Center, New Marlborough, Colebrook, Sodom, East Sheffield, Mooreville, Konkapot, North Colebrook, Riverton, Gomorrah, New Boston, Mill Brook, Montville and Robertsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
